docblock.description: The CLI equivalent of a page-controller to perform a single action.
A Getopt object for the Command; retains the short and long options passed at the command line.
The option definitions for the Getopt object.
Should Getopt be strict about how options are processed? In strict mode, passing an undefined option will throw an exception; in non-strict, it will not.
The positional (numeric) arguments passed at the command line.
Constructor.

tag.description: Standard input/output streams.

docblock.description: Passes the Context arguments to `$getopt`.
Loads `$params` from `$getopt`.
Executes the Command. In order, it does these things:
Runs at the beginning of `exec()` before `preAction()`.
Runs before `action()` but after `preExec()`.
The main logic for the Command.
Runs after `action()` but before `postExec()`.
Runs at the end of `exec()` after `postAction()`.
Collection point for information about the command-line execution context.
Values taken from $_SERVER['argv'].
Imported $_ENV values.
Imported $_SERVER values.
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Globals provided by PHP, typically `$GLOBALS`.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by key from the $env property, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $env key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $env[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by key from the $server property, or an alternate default value if that key does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The $server key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $server[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Retrieves an **unfiltered** value by position from the `$argv` property, or an alternate default value if that position does not exist.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The `$argv` positional key to retrieve the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return if the key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of $server[$key], or the alternate default value.

docblock.description: Shifts the first value off the `$argv` property and returns it. Note that this modifies the `$argv` property; if you need the original, unmodified arguments, call `server('argv')`.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value shifted off the beginning of the `$argv` property.

docblock.description: Sets the `$argv` property.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new value of `$argv`.

docblock.description: Common method to get a property value and return it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The property variable to fetch from: get, post, etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The array key in that property, if any, to get the value of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The alternative default value to return if the requested key does not exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The requested value, or the alternative default value.

docblock.description: Array of format conversions for use on a variety of pre-set console style combinations.
docblock.long-description: Based on ANSI VT100 Color/Style Codes according to the VT100 User Guide and the ANSI/VT100 Terminal Control reference. Inspired by PEAR Console_Color.

docblock.description: The POSIX terminal flag.
The PHP_OS value. Provided so we can fake the OS as needed.
Forces output to format for POSIX terminals, or to strip for non-POSIX terminals; when null, will auto-determine if the terminal is POSIX.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to force formatting, false to force stripping, or null to auto-determine.

docblock.description: Gets the value of the POSIX terminal flag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to force formatting, false to force stripping, or null to auto-determine.

docblock.description: Sets the `$php_os` value.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new PHP OS value.

docblock.description: Gets the `$php_os` value.
Converts VT100 %-markup in text to control codes.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to format.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The formatted text.

docblock.description: Strips VT100 %-markup from text.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to strip %-markup from.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The plain text.

docblock.description: Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The file handle.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

docblock.description: Writes text to a file handle, converting to control codes if the handle is a posix TTY, or to plain text if not, and then appends a newline.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The file handle.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text to write to the file handle, converting %-markup if the handle is a posix TTY, or stripping markup if not.

docblock.description: Determines if a stream handle should be treated as a POSIX terminal.

tag.name: param
